summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney dated April 4, 2008, referencing a successful child molestation prosecution and inquiring about follow-up from individuals named Drew, Jay, and Ken regarding an unspecified matter related to Epstein.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, who mentions securing a plea deal in a child molestation case and is inquiring about follow-up from others regarding an unspecified matter.

persons.name: Drew
persons.context: Person the email author is inquiring about, asking if the recipient has heard from them.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: Person who has not followed up on the author's email, mentioned alongside Ken.

persons.name: Ken
persons.context: Person who has not followed up on the author's email, mentioned alongside Jay.

connections.description: The AUSA is inquiring if the recipient has heard from Drew, suggesting a professional or case-related connection.
The AUSA notes that Jay has not followed up on an email, indicating prior professional communication.
The AUSA notes that Ken has not followed up on an email, indicating prior professional communication.

events.title: AUSA email about child molester plea
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends an email stating they secured a plea deal for a child molester resulting in a 360 to life sentence and inquires about follow-up from others.

locations.context: Office address of the Assistant U.S. Attorney, located in West Palm Beach, Florida.

keyFacts: The document is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach dated April 4, 2008.
The AUSA mentions successfully prosecuting a child molester who pleaded to a sentence of '360 to life'.
The AUSA inquires about follow-up from individuals named Drew, Jay, and Ken regarding an unspecified matter.
The email's subject line includes 'Epstein', directly linking the communication to the Epstein case.
The tone suggests the AUSA is seeking updates on a matter involving Epstein, indicated by the lack of follow-up from Jay and Ken.
